content.description: A straight forward, low-angle route with secure feet and rails. Crux is a reach below the first bolt. At the top, avoid moss to the left and go right. Good for beginners and kids.
content.location: 10 feet to the right of Russian Education System.

content.description: Ozone's 5.5 testpiece :) A good route to learn leading, setting anchors, etc. Otherwise unremarkable. 3 bolts to an anchor with rap rings. Not climbed very often so it may be mossy. Don't ask where the name comes from.
content.location: About 30 feet to the left of "Playing Hooky" and "1st Grade Problems" there are two bolted sport routes. This is the one on the left. The one on the right is about 5.7 or 5.8.

content.description:
This route is short, but an excellent route for beginners, with two variations. If you go around the small overhang to the right, there are multiple good edges and jugs around the roof and up to the anchors. The route is a bit dirty on the holds, from being new, but it will clean up quickly.

If you climb straight up, and through the roof/overhang, it is rated 5.8. Bolts can be clipped easily from either variation.
content.location: First bolted route on a short wall. Has a small overhang/roof in the middle.

content.description: This route is the line 10' to the left of Playing Hooky (5.6). Climb up to and clip the first bolt, then climb up under a small roof, and clip the bolt on the roof, then pull through and onto the roof using crimps, a mantel and a high foot. I don't feel like the move is any harder than 5.7, but for beginners or short climbers it can be tricky, and I've had several climbers tell me they think the grade is more like 5.8. fyi. Again, a bit dusty from being new.
content.location: Left of Playing Hooky. currently only the 2nd bolt line on the wall.
